definition: contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system

sentences.chinese: 甚至連種族歧視現在也是自反性的。

sentences.english: If R is reflective and transitive, then the map is continuous.
sentences.chinese: 如果R是自反和傳遞的，則這個映射是連續的。

sentences.english: Even racism is now reflexive.Consider the Balkans.
sentences.chinese: 甚至連種族歧視現在也是自反性的。

sentences.english: A reflexive relation that is also transitive is a preorder .
sentences.chinese: 滿足傳遞性的自反關係稱爲預序關係。

sentences.english: In other words it is reflexive and therefore indeterminate.
sentences.chinese: 換句話說，它是自反的，因此是不可確定的。

sentences.english: Reflexivisation has transformed the structure of social dominance.
sentences.chinese: 自反性改變了社會主導的結構。

sentences.english: Finally, it is a critical and self-reflexive approach.
sentences.chinese: 最後，它是一個批判性的與自反性的路徑。

definition: to seek the cause in oneself rather than sb else
to have a sense of shame
to examine oneself/to reflect on one's shortcomings/introspection/self-awareness/self-criticism
classical final particle, similar to modern 了[le5]
to choose the right course and follow it (idiom)
restrain yourself and return to the rites (idiom, from Analects); to subdue self and observe proprieties/(any number of possible translations)
